name: Salmon with Sauteed Tomatoes
author: T-fal
summary: A healthy flavorful dish with vibrant colors, salmon with sauteed tomatoes is a quick meal to make on a weeknight, but perfect for a special occasion. Serve over a bed of rice or cooked quinoa with steamed asparagus for a delicious dinner.
directions: Season the salmon with salt and pepper
Heat the oil in a fry pan over medium-high heat
Place salmon in the pan flesh-side down and cook for 3 to 4 minutes
Turn over to the other side and cook for approximately 3 minutes
Add in tomato halves around salmon and continue cooking for 2 minutes, or until salmon is cooked to your preference
Remove the salmon from the pan and place on a platter
Add white wine to the pan and cook for 45 seconds with the tomatoes
Serve the sauteed tomatoes over the salmon
Pass the lemon wedges at the table
